availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert H. O'Hara (Williamstown, KY, clerk and infantry private CSA)

body.p: Williamstown, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James O’Hara, Sr., and Lucy O’Hara. Student in Williamstown in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Clerk in Williamstown in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Williamstown in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 361A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 7.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 990.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 41A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 111.
